intro: Verticordia endlicheriana var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ghost orchid, is a rare and striking plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, pendulous flowers that resemble ghostly shapes. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, intricate flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in sandy soils and is typically found in heathlands and coastal areas.
